tweet: Final #MCC2019 stats: We had 800 attendees. Of the tickets we sold 15% were paid with crypto. 76.5% of those were with Bitcoin, 18.5% Litecoin and 5% Monero. 10% of all tickets were sold on the first day of the conference. 65% were sold in the last 3 weeks before the conference.

PSA: All cryptocurrency designs with privacy features may have bugs in their cryptography that allow undetectable inflation.  Examples: Zerocash, Zerocoin, RingCT (Monero), QuisQuis, and even designs with "Confidential Transactions" only, e.g., Mimblewimble (Grin), and Liquid.

@fluffypony @josema_enzo Finally, you and your community took my statements completely out of context and used then to attack Zcash. This was disgusting and beneath you. I respect your work and monero, but this shouldn't have happened

Zcash hidden inflation risk bottom line. Yes it exists. For grin & Monero too. its fundamental if you want privacy. W/o privacy, Layer 1 can't be a medium of exchange. If you're a store of value maximalist the risk isn't acceptable. But cryptocurrency is bigger than just that

Reuters is starting to report on cryptocoins. Monero was a good first choice. They seem to overplay the "crypto is used for crime" trope though; with a $1.5B mcap, Monero is small potatoes in the realm of financial crimes. Most crimes are committed in USD...
